meanings.definition: The group of professors at a university.
meanings.sent1: The professoriats gathered for a meeting in the lecture hall.
meanings.sent2: The professoriats discussed the upcoming research projects.
meanings.sent3: The professoriats decided to have a picnic on the campus lawn.
meanings.sent4: The professoriats stood together like a forest of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The professoriats' unity made the university proud.

meanings.definition: The tenure or position of a professor.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, she finally achieved a professoriats.
meanings.sent2: His professoriats was well-deserved after his groundbreaking research.
meanings.sent3: The professoriats' office was filled with books and papers.
meanings.sent4: The professoriats' influence spread far beyond the classroom.
meanings.sent5: Earning the professoriats brought a sense of accomplishment.

meanings.sent1: The professoriats met to discuss curriculum changes.
meanings.sent2: The professoriats' opinions varied on the new grading system.
meanings.sent3: The professoriats' potluck was a delicious gathering.
meanings.sent4: The professoriats' expertise covered a wide range of subjects.
meanings.sent5: The professoriats' collaboration led to innovative research projects.
